remarks: ` P ` divides the I -th derivative of ` F ` applied to ` J ` . if it is not the case that ` I = P - 1 ` and ` J = 0 ` .  This is case 1 and the second part of case 2 proven in in [Juillerat] p. 13 .  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 5-Apr-2020.)
statement:
etransclem38.p $e |- ( ph -> P e. NN ) $.
etransclem38.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN0 ) $.
etransclem38.f $e |- F = ( x e. RR |-> ( ( x ^ ( P - 1 ) ) x. prod_ j e. ( 1 ... M ) ( ( x - j ) ^ P ) ) ) $.
etransclem38.i $e |- ( ph -> I e. NN0 ) $.
etransclem38.j $e |- ( ph -> J e. ( 0 ... M ) ) $.
etransclem38.ij $e |- ( ph -> -. ( I = ( P - 1 ) /\ J = 0 ) ) $.
etransclem38.c $e |- C = ( n e. NN0 |-> { c e. ( ( 0 ... n ) ^m ( 0 ... M ) ) | sum_ j e. ( 0 ... M ) ( c ` j ) = n } ) $.
etransclem38 $p |- ( ph -> P || ( ( ( ( RR Dn F ) ` I ) ` J ) / ( ! ` ( P - 1 ) ) ) ) $.
$d C c j n x $.
$d I c j n $.
$d I c j n x $.
$d J c j n x $.
$d M c j n $.
$d M c j n $.
